6.25.19  2:56 pm   Wanna team up to save the world

     sure

6.25.19  1:35 pm   I have this thing I'm creating and it requires a large amount of knowledge to complete. Of the tasks that need to be accomplished to finish this thing, I (at this moment) only have the skills necessary to complete about 20% of it. Due to advice received from other people, I've spent the last 4 months trying to work with other people who have the other 80% of the skills I need and as a result, I feel like I have wasted the last 4 months of time I could have spent working because I'm no further along in the process than I was before. Each time I find another human who I think can contribute, I end up moving backwards.

I think this is because of a few things. 1) they're only focused on what they will get out of it monetarily (which is fair and also achievable with this thing I have begun to create, but their focus on money rewards doesn't accomplish anything). 2) they wait for me to spoon feed the creative process into their brains to fill i n incomp lete holes in the vision instead of trying things themselves. 3) If they do make anything, they protect all parts of it instead of submitting to the creative editing and improvement process.

The world is telling me that at some point I will just find these people and that if I keep asking everyone I meet for help on the project, I will eventually finish the thing.

BUT. I'm really starting to think that this isn't true and that what the OG creator is telling me is that I need to do this alone. I need to spend the time teaching myself to do the other 80% and then just do it.

Now I'm wandering my house feeling angry that this is something I have to do by myself. I really like other humans and it's hard for me to believe that I alone can make something as incredible in real life as what I'm seeing and hearing in my head.

Because this is going to take a really long time. And I'm already lonely. But I gotta do it. And I'm crying. Cause I'm scar ed. And it's so much work.



Is the next step to teach myself all those other skills? And then once I have an approximate idea of how to use the tools, I start making whatever the best version of the thing I can. And then I start showing it to people? Is that right?

     yes but i might suggest not doing the biggest project first. things will flow so much more smoothly if you can integrate the doing and the learning. learn a bit, do a bit. try learning and doing at the same time. the part about working alone, yes, you are absolutely right, you must work alone. that part is true. i remember the pivotal moment my life was changed when i found out that some people are actually built to work alone and it's ok. all it took was to hear an important artist come out and say that's what they do and it's just how they are. then i started looking around and found quite a few other people who are the same way. many many people do great in groups, but, it's important to recognize that many people also work alone. there are advantages and disadvantages to both. disadvantages to working alone are insanely bloated production time, and your brain eating itself. but the advantages are off the wall

6.25.19  12:30 pm   When you record a song, do you have an arrangement mapped out/in mind going into it, or is there a lot that you work out as you record it?

     before: chart, melody, lyric, chord, exact tempo, full road map. maybe a groove hint or other hints
     along the way: anything else. all other decisions necessary to deliver the above chart to the listener's ear

6.25.19  11:49 am   is "i'm best friends with my own front door" metaphorical?

     has a check box in preferences

6.25.19  11:06 am   how do you feel about memes

     boring compared to supermemes

6.25.19  10:45 am   recommendations on something fun to learn about?

     shapes

6.25.19  10:42 am   There are too many songs so how do i pick which one to record

     first put them all in a list. then, go through the list from bottom to top and choose as many songs as you want. be generous, choose songs you would like to record 'eventually.' once you have that second list, don't delay, it will be temping to do round2 and narrow it down to dust until there's nothing left, but don't. count them quickly, and go to random.org and get a random number (set range accordingly) and set it in stone as fast as you can. don't even look up the title just yet ..... just write down the number and let it sink in that your decision is made, and was healthily balanced between random and genuine. This is a summary of many years of negotiations i've had between the 2 ends of this spectrum

6.25.19  9:23 am   Can you be in your next video shirtless?

     no

     i think so

6.25.19  8:02 am   do you think my question will make a lot more sense if I make the question window real large?

     yes

6.25.19  7:28 am   i think i can play faster if i memorize the chords from the bottom up and kinda mentally bring em up that way as opposed to saving a 4-note pattern on one hand and another 4 note pattern on the other, do you usually see them as either of these ways or something different? i think by memorizing as 2 sets of 4 i kind of become close minded on finger usage, and when learning from bottom up or atleast running the mental checklist before  summoning up the memorized chord it feels faster and more natural to just use my fingers and start building bottom up, that way i kind of train natural/reasonable finger placement too when solving the puzzle quickly everytime instead of memorizing what finger does what and missing out on some of the fun

     i don't quite know what you're talking about

6.25.19  6:02 am   is it time to sleep yet?

     no

6.25.19  2:21 am   i have been editing down some of your video shorts into the most coherent audio only versions i can make.  i have been really struck by the cohesive rhythmic flow throughout the entirety of some of these videos.  have you ever made one of the video shorts like 'blades of grass' or 'ball and stick' to a click all the way through including the spoken word sections?

     they won't adhere to a click. spoken environments are distinctly different in that they are not gonna sync to a click. timing is of the utmost essence but it is not governed by a steady click. it is governed by spoken thought patterns

6.25.19  1:02 am   does the audible pop at 8 seconds into 'hi, i'm steve' bother you?  of course the video did well.  and the entire project is amazing and i love it.  but when i find myself doing projects, i stress really hard about stupid things like that and i wonder how you handle it.

     clearly if i knew about it it wouldn't be there. also in 2 years i've never heard anyone report that, so it might be below what's known in the biz as the 'threshhold of reasonability'

Do you think I should try my best to continue that pace or disregard that for the sake of completion to the best of my abilities?

     there might be some interesting new journeys just around the corner. something a little different

6.24.19  3:46 pm   6.22.19  11:21 pm

Since you're talking video game music. What time signature is NES Super Mario Bros (the 1st game) Underworld theme in? Does is just resets at a certain point? 

     the later games usually 4ify it, but the original actually cheats. the first part is 3/4 but a hair short. then the long part of the riff seems to go into 4 but the long silence at the end has an undistinct amount of time added to it. it's underground. no need to conform to any societies timecode, right

6.24.19  5:47 am   Why do you answer questions so late in the night/early in the morning?

     Do you ever sleep?

     yes

      When??

     usually for about 40% of the day, it doesn't matter when, as long as it's all at once. it most often echoes the time i did it the previous day
